Reviews.Title: Making a case for LG; amazing tv.
Reviews.Author: Is It Dead Yet
Reviews.Content: LG does'nt get enough praise.Just bought this TV for the sake of it being an IPS panel and for its apparent adjustability (and also 1080p). Plus this tv is so easy to calibrate; the 'picture wizard' is extremely helpful.The amount of menu options is jaw-dropping, as is the style of the set. The LH40 model looks neat with the plastic square along the bottom of the panel, but I like the more minimalist look of the LH30, and I do not like the 120hz or the $100 price jump of the LH40.I made a comparison to my sony 32M4000 (which I have now given to my father) and there are some interesting differences (many are polar opposites):-The sound is far superior on the LG.-Black levels are very close, sony's is a bit deeper and maintains black  colors better at angles.-The whiteness of whites is slightly better on the sony, but colors and mid tones definitely have more of a 'punchy' factor on the LG.-Color is amazing; rich and saturated; best ive seen on any LCD, period.-Color does not wash out at all from different angles, only very dark colors and black tend to become discolored (blue or red depending on the angle).-Of course there are far, far fewer picture options on the sony.-My sony has a ghosting problem with dark colors, not so on the LG; motion blur and lag is also reduced too.-OTA HD channels look decent enough, not as sharp as the sony, but the better color makes up for it imo.What was the main factor that made me get this LG?..its S-IPS panel. Samsung is an excellent maker of lcds, but I steered clear of them this time, as buying a tv from them is like playing the lottery. They use 3 different panels with differing levels of color and contrast quality; you are not essentially getting what you pay for: You may get Samsung's own S-PVA panel, the best quality (if you're lucky). An A-MVA panel from Taiwan's AUO (a notch worse than S-PVA). Chinese company Chi Mei's S-MVA panel (worst of the three).Panasonics IPS Alpha panels are decent, but on some panels dark colors appear far too blue from different angles.That narrows it down to LG's S-IPS panel; its color saturation, vividness, and response time are worth the slight sacrifice in contrast and black depth (at least in my opinion).This tv is not perfect, however; I spotted 3 dead pixels right out of the box (2 bright, 1 dark), right around the middle of the screen. They are practically invisible without being a foot from the screen and looking hard for them, however.Viewing angles demonstrate some darkening of the picture, but its not too bothersome (swivel stand helps).No other flaws I can think of at the moment, I recommend this tv!My calibration settings use color adjustments from cnet.com along with some of my own tweaks, try them out!Picture menu:Aspect ratio: Just SizeEnergy Saving: OffPicture Mode: Expert 2Backlight: 60Contrast: 88Brightness: 58H Sharpness: 60V Sharpness: 60Color: 50Tint: 0--Expert control menuDynamic contrast: OffNoise reduction: OffGamma: MediumBlack level: LowReal Cinema: On [grayed out]Color Standard: HD [grayed out]Color Gamut: WideEdge Enhancer: OffxvYCC: Auto [grayed out]OPC: OffExpert Pattern: Off[grayed out]Color Filter: OffWhite balance: MediumMethod: 10 point IREPattern: OuterIRE: [see below]Luminance: 137 (100 Luminance only, 90 through 10 are preset)-- 10 point IRE calibrationIRE: [Red, Green, Blue results, respectively, for each IRE point]100 [-8, 1, -40]90 [-13, -5, -40]80 [-20, -12, -40]70 [-17, -14, -33]60 [-17, -12, -31]50 [-17, -13, -26]40 [-13, -12, -19]30 [-6, -4, -8]20 [-6, -4, -10]10 [2, 3, -1]Color management systemRed color: 2Red tint: 0Green color: -1Green tint: -7Blue color: 2Blue tint: 7Yellow color: 0Yellow tint: 1Cyan color: 0Cyan tint: 0Magenta color: 0Magenta tint: -2

Reviews.Title: Okay, but not great
Reviews.Author: T. Doyle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon supplier Tiger Direct based on Amazon reviews in early November 2009.  We have a two year old 32" Samsung HD LCD TV that we were moving to another room and the LG TV was purchased to replace to older TV. My wife and I both found the quality of the picture to be inferior to the Samsung.  Moreover, the biggest problem with the LG TV was the deterioration in picture quality with viewing angle.  The LG also seemed to have a slight problem keeping audio and video in sync on a few programs, somthing we had not noted in our other TVs (we have four flat panel TVs in all - only one is HD)  Given the room we planned to place it in required a wide viewing angle, we returned the TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Economy HDTV
Reviews.Author: Playingpossum
Reviews.Content: The LG 32LH30 32-Inch 1080p replaced a 720p 32 inch Samsung which I returned because of erratic sound quality.  The LG provides a very clear picture for upscaled DVD movies and over the air digital signals. The speakers provide excellent sound for a small living room although the addition of a home theater system would substantially increase movie enjoyment. Standard definition signals also reproduce a stable clear picture.  Colors are very good and the set provides sufficient tools to tweak the picture for personal preference. I have not used it for bluray as yet but HD from satellite is very good. The features of this unit described on the Amazon specifications list accurately describe its features and can be relied upon. I am not a hard core cinema/video buff but I cannot imagine that this unit will not satisfy most viewers who want a well priced midsized flat screen high definition TV.  My five stars are based upon what I expect in similarly designed and priced units for a smaller room.05/14/2010  I have just connected the LG 32LH30 to a blueray player as well as a WII with Netflex connectivity.  They both work well and the LG's bluray images are as sharp and vivid as those on my 40 inch Sony Bravia.  I continue to be pleased with my purchase although I must also report the failure of the remote control (just out of warranty).  LG customer support referred me to a third party vendor who sold me a replacement for about $17.00.  This was my first failure of a remote since they were first introduced way back when.

Reviews.Title: Stylish and perfect
Reviews.Author: CallMeB "Big B"
Reviews.Content: First, I am feeling cheated right now, since I paid over [...] for this TV around a few months back. On the other hand, there is a lot of positive things about this TV which I really appreciate.1. The picture quality is just amazing. It really has a enriched color display and your experience with sports will probably be awesome.2. When viewed from various angles, there is very little depreciation of real output and a few faded spots do appear. On a comparison with other models, this is very minimal. Also, you would be viewing from a good distance, which voids the issue. We also use the swivel when you hook it up for games.5. I have it connected with DVD players and it is awesome so far. I saw this 37" 1080p [...]which is also glossy black at a local store and is just a [...] extra.It depends on your viewing distance and how far your sofa is from the television. With 1080p and a deep discount, I would call this a deal!!

Reviews.Title: Latest Revision not for the better (audio/video sync, panel type)
Reviews.Author: C. Simons "cs"
Reviews.Content: Buyer be warned, some of the specifications of this particular TV model have changed in just the last couple of months.Change #1: The panel is no longer an S-IPS panel.  After November 2009, all revisions now have a TFT panel.  The result is that the color depth you will see is 8-bit versus the 10-bit with the S-IPS panel.  LG, and most TV manufacturers, are not required to announce a change in the design or specifications of their models.  To be fair, the picture quality is still very good, in my opinion, and the number of tweaks available to adjust the display settings are similar to those that you would find in a very high-end TV.Change #2: Yes, the audio/video sync issues are in full-effect.  It only occurs over HDMI...but then that's one of the main points of buying a HD-TV, no?  On some HD stations, the sync issue is not that noticeable.  On others, especially movie channels like TNT HD, you will find a 1-2 second audio delay.  I tried to correct this issue via the service menu but did not notice any improvement.Apparently LG has a software fix for this issue; I called and scheduled an appointment to have a technician apply the software fix.  I hope this remedies the audio/video sync problem as otherwise I will have to return this TV.Overall, it's still a good TV, and hopefully LG will release a newer batch VERY SOON with the updated software fix.  Otherwise, it is something that can be remedied, and you might not notice it at all.  Just be aware of what you're getting into.Also note that OneCall says they do not offer returns for TV's over 20 inches...

Reviews.Title: Known audio problems...be warned
Reviews.Author: Somewhere in TX
Reviews.Content: Purchased this LG tv after reading the amazon reviews.  Once I received it and hooked it up via HDMI cable to my DVR, I noticed a problem immediately.  The audio & video are HORRIFICALLY out of sync.  The audio is delayed by one second or more and makes it impossible to watch.  I thought it might be the cable box so I called Time Warner and they swapped out my cable box for a new one.  It made zero difference.  Finally I called LG tech support and they didnt even ask me that many questions and said it was a known issue.  They took my information and are sending a tech out to fix it.  They claim that they are aware that there is a problem and there is a fix but it requires a tech to physically make a visit.  After the call, I did deeper research and there are tons of internet postings about this same issue with folks all over the place extremely upset.I then waited for 2 weeks and never heard back from LG.  Called again and was told that they are getting swamped with calls on this issue and that they had no idea when I would get service.  They said to call back after a month (!) if I hadnt heard back from them!!  They claim that if you dont use HDMI, the problem goes away.  But thats the reason I bought a 1080i TV....for the HDMI.  Needless to say, please dont purchase from LG and pick another brand, at least for a while.  Also, I purchased from Adorama Camera (via Amazon) and they have a no return policy for TV's which is amazing and quite a shock.  So I am stuck with this TV whether I like it or not.

Reviews.Title: Great value, but beware, newer units are made with worse technology.
Reviews.Author: Thoughtful Thinker
Reviews.Content: First off, this is my first LCD TV ever and I must say it is a really great unit. I originally bought it after doing research and discovering that LG used the coveted S-IPS panels in their TV's which offered very wide viewing angles and beautiful 10-bit color. However, after getting my TV home, it seemed a little different, so I did some more research and discovered that LG switched to MVA panels in SEPT '09 without informing it's customers. The MVA panel has a narrower viewing angle than the IPS and it only has 8-bit color. As a plus though, it has MUCH deeper black levels than the IPS and a lower price. Overall, the TV is still great, but I was disappointed because I expected to get an IPS panel. The CNET review no longer applies due to the new panel, so beware and be willing to try it out for yourself. (I doubt you'll be disappointed overall).+ Great price for 1080p+ 50,000:1 Dynamic contrast+ 3 HDMI hooks+ Fairly deep blacks+ Nice menu system w/lots of settings+ Swivel base| Average Sound| Very slightly noticable motion blur (worse for dark scenes in videogames)- 8-bit color does not blow you away- Only 1 Component hook- No headphone jack- Narrow viewing angle (color and black levels begin to wash out when viewed off-center)

Reviews.Title: Best 32" LCD on the Market
Reviews.Author: J. Cook
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the LG 32LH30.  Fantastic picture and sound quality in a beautiful glossy black frame.  Before purchasing, compared this with other entry-level 1080p sets; almost purchased the Sony S series until I saw a side-by-side comparison.  In my opinion, LG makes the best 32" LCD on the market.  Only complaints are the poor layout of the remote control and no analog stereo outputs, but otherwise, a great product for the money.  I'm now considering the larger LH90 series for the family room.  And, thanks to Amazon for the quick service and on-time delivery.

Reviews.Title: LG 32LH30 - Great Value & Picture
Reviews.Author: Edward Lane
Reviews.Content: Having recently bought a 42" LG for my family room, when I decided to outfit my bedroom, I stuck with LG and I am glad I did.  Although "conventional wisdom" says you don't need 1080P on a 32" set, I am glad I paid the small extra for it on this model.Setup was a no-brainer, the picture is phenomenal, and I think LG is a far better value than similar sets from Samsung and others.  Best about the LG models is the dizzying array of picture controls, so no matter your particular pleasure, you can be sure you'll find a setting you like, or ones you can modify to suit your tastes.Although I have home theater also installed in the bedroom, I ran the HDMI cable from the cable box direct to the TV and for everyday TV viewing the sound is fine.  But I ran optical from the cable box to the receiver, so when I want to watch a movie in Dolby 5.1, it's there.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Arlene V. Iannazzi
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV you could buy.  The size is just right for my small den.  The picture quality is absolutely fantastic.  Very easy to use and set up. This is our second LG HDTV.(Other TV is 52 inches) The customer service is beyond words. I hesitated buying a television on line but the reviews made by other buyers convinced me to go for it.  I am not sorry.  Needless to say, I am very happy with my purchase.  Thanks Amazon for YOUR great service also.

Reviews.Title: I got a bad one...
Reviews.Author: Bradley J. Turner
Reviews.Content: Before we bought a 1080p screen, I wanted my wife to see the difference between the 60 and 120 hz 1080's. She thought the 120 hz ruined the "movie" look of films(it looks too real). We went with this LG 32LH30 because it fit within our budget and size restrictions for our living room setup.When we got it home and removed the tv from the box, we noticed cat or dog hair clinging on the unit. We do not have pets-or have ever had an animal in the house. We carefully brushed off what he could.We attached our blu-ray player to HDMI port 3. We turned it on and tried our blu-ray player first. The picture was amazing just using the factory settings right out of the box. We couldn't be happier.We attached our our current cable box (analog until it can get switched to HD) to the AV1 (RCA Yellow video, left,right audio) import. The TV did not recognize the RCA video signal on its AV1 import. I thought maybe it was the cable box or cord, so i tried a video game system with a different cord in the same inputs, but it couldn't recognize that video signal either. I plugged the cable box in again and the screen popped up a message saying that it detected a new signal. The analog cable worked. Yay. We went to dinner.When we came back from dinner, we turned on the tv and the picture (both HDMI and AV1) was noticeably darker. We thought maybe the bulb needed time to warm up, so we gave it 1/2 hour to warm up. The screen was still dark. I adjusted every color setting on the set to as bright as it could go, but the picture stayed dark. Our cable box and blu-ray menu screens were too dark to read. The next morning we turned the tv back on, and the picture was getting even darker. It had been less than 24 hours since we bought the tv.We also noticed that there was a slight, but noticeable image burn on the edges of 4:3 content would be displayed.We returned the tv and swapped it for a new one. The AV1 recognized my cable box from the start, and the "input" source selection menu shows connected inputs in color now. So far, the picture has been good, but I'm still nervous everytime I turn it on.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but for the price GREAT TV
Reviews.Author: KD
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased to go into our basement and replace an old 36" Toshiba behemoth of a set.  We use this area for working out, and have it wired for surround sound.  This set is really nice, and for a 1080 with 50,000:1 contrast ratio, there wasn't another TV around that came for the price I got on Amazon ($389)!!  That being said, I think that our 42" Panasonic Vierra has a better picture and more features.  Also, I don't think that the sound on this LG is anything great - so I am happy that we have it hooked up to our surround system.  All in all, I don't really think that you can beat this TV - great picture, good features and a great price tag!!BTW - I decided to call a CS Rep at Crutchfield to discuss this set, and they gave it rave reviews, however they could not come down on their price ($550).  He said that he doesn't know how Amazon sells their TV's so cheaply, but acknowledged that they would not price match with Amazon.  I then went to Best Buy, who also said that although they do price-match, they do not with Amazon. I guess that Amazon is the right place to buy a good tv...

Reviews.Title: Best 1080p 60Hz HDTV in its class. Hands Down
Reviews.Author: Ron Sochacki
Reviews.Content: BEFORE BUYING THIS TV....I've been doing research on HDTVs for about a year. My new hobby now is high quality entertainment and wanted to get the best TV for quailty picture and price. LG is a great company with beautiful quality that produces very detailed color and picture. I knew this because my girl friend's parents have a 32" LG 720p in their family room which kind of inspired me to go with LG. Picture is much cleaner and more clear than most TV's I've seen for under $600 at bestbuy.For the most part, I love Baseball and watching the team with the best fans and best city to play in, the Chicago Cubs. I try to watch almost every game along with the Chicago Blackhawks from time to time. PlayStation 3 is another hobby of mine. And have been playing and watching on a Tube my whole life, currently was running off a 23" Symphonic tube TV. Like I mentioned, I love the PS3 and have been playing since 1998 PSOne and accustomed to the controller. Love the 1080p blu-ray feature and the stunning blu-ray graphics processed by the Cell chip. But I was getting nowhere near the quality and picture I should be getting. I knew i had to upgrade, as time went on the tube tv became more pathetic day by day, "What am I looking at!?!?!"The day the HDTV came, 01/21/10, WHAT TO EXPECT....Holy cow!!! This HDTV came fast and a HUGE beautiful box. 32" was bigger than I expected but really is the best size tv for my small room. Any bigger or smaller would not make me as satisfied as I am already. I went from a 23" tube Symphonic to 32" LG 1080p 60Hz with a contrast ratio of 50,000:1 which has amazing black details. Since the TV is running at only 60Hz, the picture tends to almost skip/blur when imagies or the camera are moved across the screen quickly. But overall movements are only noticable if you really pay close attention and look for that sort of thing. On some of the slower shots and still frames, it's like looking through an F'in WINDOW. Blu-ray movies are absolutly mind blowing. Watching the DisneyNature film Earth in Blu-Ray was breath taking. You get a feeling of almost being there. I showed the family and they couldn't believe their eyes because they're still stuck on old, dead technology, and by that I mean Tube Televisions. I can't even look at a tube tv without seeing a bunch of lines going across and static it seems like. I feel bad for you tube tv owners. This HDTV has AMAZING picture/color quality for a great price. This is a $600 TV at bestbuy not including tax so you're looking at at least $650 at BestBuy. Going from a Tube to a HDTV is really a black and white difference. PlayStation 3 looks amazing, it's almost like upgrading my entire PS3, it's completely different and better in every way! I can go on and on about this TV. "Is it a TV or something better?" is a perfect mato for this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HD for the price
Reviews.Author: Stephen Haberman
Reviews.Content: I bought this television about 4 months ago at about the same price. There really is not many televisions that can compare at this price range. The television has 3 hdmi inputs as well as several others for aux and hd 5-6 prong cables.The picture is crisp, it will suffer from the quick action blur during some sporting events (i saw it a little in football) but at this price, its is a minimal issue. Before this tv, i owned a Samsung 1080i HD-tube tv and the difference is clear. If you want to have the crisp darks and grey scale, Samsung might be for you, but this picture performs best with colorful scenes. You can see a clear difference in color quality when watching baseball. Colors are just crisper on this LG. I am an avid gmaer and blu-ray watcher. The only qualm i have is the sound quality isn't anything special. With a blu-ray in the ps3, and using my hdmi cords, i have never had an issue with the sound. It is just watching cable or a regular dvd when i find myself turning the tv up substantially. The sound will be strong enough to give you a jolt during the action scenes tho. So, as i said, it isn't a major concern for me.Unless you are looking at lcd or higher end names, this is a great tv for just about anyone.

Reviews.Title: Very nice little set.
Reviews.Author: A. Kuempel
Reviews.Content: This TV preforms very well although the lack of 120Hz or 240Hz is very apparent, more so even than I expected. My other set is a 46 inch Mitsubishi w/120Hz so maybe I'm just really used to that. But for the price and other features given on this set this is still a great TV! I will say that if I were to do it again and this TV was available with an option to get the 120Hz processing and that option was $100.00 or less I would pay the extra.

Reviews.Title: LG what an experience!
Reviews.Author: Levi
Reviews.Content: Here I go again with a review of the LG LH30 32 inch 1080P LCD TV.I have seen and used alot of brands like Pioneer Elite Plasmas, Sony LCD, Samsung DLP and Mitsubishi DLP.Well I have to say that the LG stands out the most for the amazing price of $524.The Picture quality is second to none, it is the BEST 32 inch LCD I have ever used or seen.I use the LG for Videogames (XBOX 360 and PS3) @ 1080P and for movies via Bluray and DVD.The games look very vivid and natural, especially games like Resident Evil 5, Uncharted 2, and Gears of War I and II.Very satisfied with the videogames on this TV.For movies I use a Sony BDP-S350 Bluray player @ 1080P and a Denon DVD-955S Universal DVD Player.The Bluray's look amazing eventhough I will upgrade my Sony to a Denon or Marantz shortly.But I was very impressed with the DVD's via Denon 955S because the TV I used before was nothing like the LG.Of course for getting this amazing picture from DVD's I can mainly thank LG and Denon for the performance I got.The Contrast on this TV is sure amazing because I have not seen blacks like this before on any 32 inch LCD.I seriously believe that LG is right up there with the Pioneer Elite TV's which sadly are no longer being made.The look of the LG is extraordinary, very nice Piano Black sides and a very nice chrome bar on the bottom which has an LED light on the right hand side, it glows dark red when the TV is in sleep mode and a very nice dark blue when the TV is on.The Energy saving feature is great you can adjust how much energy you want the TV to save and the sound is very good, eventhough I am using seperate speakers and subwoofer for my sound. I still cannot believe the performance and look of this TV.LG did something that Sony and Vizio should learn to master.I also believe Samsung and LG are the top TV's no matter what size.I highly recommend this TV to anyone who wants the best for an amazing price.Do yourself a favor and buy an LG, I sure will only buy LG from now on.Thank You LG for making Life Good.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, surpassed expectations!
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Shea "The Goob"
Reviews.Content: It is a 32 inch TV so I wasn't looking for anything Amazing!! I wanted it for the bedroom and didn't have high expectations, just wanted a halfway decent TV. Turns out that this TV is great! Picture quality is very good! Settings in the menu were quite a surprise. Picture is Highly customizable. Though I do have to add that the Picture Wizard feature worked great for me. I'm sure that there are those who want to fine tune it their self but the Picture Wizard was fairly quick and optimized the picture to my liking. The Invisable speakers system actually sounds pretty good as far as TV speakers go. It is made up of things called "exciters" that attach to the thin frame around the TV on the inside and, in essense, cause the frame to become the speaker. At least that is what I read online after some pretty detailed searching. It wasn't easy to find out EXACTLY how the speaker system worked. I believe it was an LG asian site that had the diagram on how it worked. Anyways they sound OK for a TV speaker. I recommend this TV, exellent picture!! I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Haley Faye Gowen "weathergal675"
Reviews.Content: I have never bought a TV  and I think I read every review on the internet before deciding on this one. I compared the same TV at BB and other sites and Amazon was the best deal. I signed up for Amazon Prime when ordering this TV and got it extremely fast. Nothing was wrong with the packaging, not even a dent on the box! It was very easy to set up and the picture wizard was excellent. I have HD channels and a Blueray player so the 1080p is great!

Reviews.Title: Very Happy With This TV.
Reviews.Author: J. Hurley
Reviews.Content: What initially drew me to this TV was the price. The TV at the time was under 500 hundred dollars, no tax, and free shipping. I was relatively hesitant to purchase a TV online since I could not compare and contrast without going to a store and finding similar if not same models.I am very happy with the purchase. LG HDTV's have great contrast and the color seems to "pop" more than other brands. With an HDMI cable and a PS3, the visuals get down right beautiful. There are obviously much much much better HDTV's on the market but this is the one that caught my eye because it has plenty of value behind it. 32" is the perfect size for my living room since I sit only 5-6 feet away from it.I would recommend this TV to anyone. The packaging was good, no dings, dents, tears, scuffs, etc. The TV came out pristine.

Reviews.Title: Price and Features, this is the best you can find
Reviews.Author: Mr. Light
Reviews.Content: To Compare its features and the price it is the best 32 inch LCD TV I can find. I did read a few different 32-Inch specs and user menus. Samsung and Sharp (I do not remember what modles) are better than this one but about $300 higher. JVC (1080p at sam's club) about the same price (but $40 tax) and feature but this one has a better picture quality. Vizio has different modles and the picture quality none of them better than this one. I also compare LG32LH40 (120Hz) with this one about $100 higher but some reviews of LG32LH40 reporting few minor issues.

Reviews.Title: excellent value
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Araki
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the bedroom, have it connected to a DVD player and a Mac Mini for Netflix streaming with a DVI-HDMI cable using the input that allows for a separate audio connection. Not a high end TV set, but has very good image and ability to connect several sources at a low cost.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Even better price
Reviews.Author: LCG "LG"
Reviews.Content: After spending numerous hrs online, Best Buy and Fry's, decided on 32LH30.  I was debating between this tv and Samsung LN32B550 to replace a Samsung LN32B540 (720p).  I've had the samsung 720p a few days and picture quality is excellent except it's not 1080p.  The main purpose of this TV will be as a 2nd computer monitor, the other is a 23" LG W2353V.Went to bestbuy and compared image quality, it seem identical, but TVs were not side by side.Fry's actually has both the Samsung 550 and LG H30 side by side so you can do a nice comparison.  Samsung has deeper blacks.  The LGs seem more on the green/gray side when compared only to the Samsung.I played a bit with the settings but couldnt replicate the blacks produced by Samsung.  However all other colors are almost if not identical to the samsung (GREAT!!!).  At Fry's they were playing iRobot this is where the black levels are noticeable, the TVs were also playing some HD landscape content and here it really becomes a coin toss between Samsung and LG.  Some scenes look better on LG others on Samsung.  I dont think you can go wrong with either set.  However you will pay a little more for the Samsung,  I do have a slight preference to the Samsung bezel though.  I figure since I'm already using another LG screen this will compliment it well.LG is a clear winner on price.  LH30 $450, Samsung 550 is $650However if your looking for a bigger TV run to your local Fry's...LG42LH40 $547 and the 47" for a few $$ more (website shows higher prices)Too bad 42" is a little too big as computer screen since I sit about 2 feet away

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: M. Norton
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV at the end of December and, after one month, we are very happy with it.  For context, my wife and I are not terribly sophisticated (or enthusiastic) users of electronics, we don't use a gaming system, and we aren't big sports buffs.  We watch a lot of movies and probably more TV than we should--mostly sitcoms and some sports.  So we were looking for the least expensive 32", 1080p LCD set from a "reputable brand"--e.g. LG, Panasonic, Samsung & Sony.  One month in we are completely satisfied.As for particulars, we have no complaints about the image quality, we run the audio through our receiver, so I can't really attest to the audio, and setting up the TV was quick and easy.  Aesthetically I consider the set to be on the nice looking side of average.  Maybe not as cool as the new Samsung LEDs, but still nice to look at.  My only reservation is that (I think) you need to install a bracket in the wall to mount it.People who are super-serious about home entertainment should probably check out other reviews, but for those of you are just looking for a straightforward flatscreen that covers the basics, I highly recommend this set.p.s. Bought the set using a trial membership to Amazon Prime, so it was delivered next day for $4.  A nice option that's worth looking into, just remember to cancel that Prime membership if you don't want to pay the $79 annual fee.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Elliot Richman "Muss es sein? Es muss sein!"
Reviews.Content: I love this TV!!! I got this as a second TV after I rewired my house with 75-ohm because I had to get a new antenna (a giant Winegard antenna with a 14-foot boom in my attic) after the transition to digital. At this time I use it only for OTA digital signal. It is so sharp and clear and beautiful I just love it. I have no complaints. Its tuner is strong (apparently stronger than that on a major competitor's TV I bought 18 months earlier) and the controls are easy to use. I find myself watching ridiculous things that no normal person would watch simply because the picture is so incredible. The blades of grass on a live golf broadcast are hypnotizing, mesmerizing, captivating.

Reviews.Title: Best in Class for This Size and Price
Reviews.Author: B. V. Dam "California Candyman"
Reviews.Content: After tons of research I decided on this maker and model and I love this TV.  I agree with other reviewers that the blacks are not as black as they could be but most LCD's in this size category have the same issue. It has not diminished my satisfaction.PROSExcellent picture qualityVivid colors without being over saturatedNo noticeable blurring or pixelationBlue Ray Movies in 1080 look incredibleSUPER simple setup.  When you first turn it on, it automatically guides you thru the setup...(no manual needed here)We have basic cable and the autoscan found over 40 channels I never knew we had (music and HD)Excellent on screen menus that make adjusting picture, sleep mode, etc. easy (within days you can access without even looking at the remote)Everything on it feels solid, no jiggly buttons or inferior feel, even the remote is well madeExcellent styling.  This unit is just nice to look at.  Smooth lines, clean and modern.CONSAbility to produce deep blacks as stated aboveNearly all TV's regardless of what you spend have weak stock speakers so I rate sound as good but not great. Fine for TV, get external speakers for movies.All in all this is high value: A great 32" 1080P LCD for under $500. All other models in the sub-$500/$400 category come with sacrifices (some serious).

Reviews.Title: Great buy for a 1080p TV
Reviews.Author: Everfree
Reviews.Content: A great buy for a 1080p TV. This TV has tons of features to adjust the picture. The picture wizard didn't do much for me, but the expert menus are great. Each input on the TV has its own picture settings, which is both a blessing and a curse. Blacks could be deeper (especially at angles), but can be enhanced significantly with the proper settings. Despite reviews that I've read, I think blacks are actually superior to most LCD TVs in its class when set correctly. No dead or stuck pixels. My only gripe is that there are some uniformity issues. There are some very faint vertical bars across the LCD where the image is slightly darker. These are only really visible out of the corner of your eye during scenes with moving backgrounds. They're mostly visible with blue hues and when viewing from off-angles.I don't have a Blu-ray player yet, but DVDs look fantastic through HDMI. I appreciated the array of appropriate options for aspect ratio and display. SD TV is rather ugly, but that's to be expected. That said, there is a noise reduction feature which cleans up the SD signals very nicely. Hooked up the Wii through component cables at 480p--looks nice. I also love the fact that I can hook it up to my laptop and make use of every last 1080p pixel. There is an auto-adjustment feature in the picture menu that can align your VGA output to fit the TV if it comes up off-center at first. One gripe here is that the TV doesn't seem to auto-detect my VGA connection like it does with HDMI, component, etc... you have to manually use the directional arrows to select VGA from the input menu. It works, even though it appears to be grayed out.Overall, the menus are very logical and easy to use. I was especially happy (and surprised) by the simplicity of the remote control, and the directional keys have a nice feel to them. Switching between inputs is a breeze, and the ability to add labels to the inputs in the selection menu (appropriate pictorial representations included) is a great feature. I love that it detects which inputs have something plugged in and lists them first. It's so easy the rest of my family can actually use it without having to call me to help ;)Sound seems very good for a flat-panel. It has good clarity and surprisingly deep bass. The bass doesn't cause the set to rattle at all, which is a plus. It's nothing awe-inspiring, but it sounded better than most of the other brands at the store.It's also a beauty, design-wise. Assuming it continues to be reliable, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Utilitarian - A good Thing
Reviews.Author: Terry A
Reviews.Content: Bought it because I considered it the best value among 32 inch LCDs.  Am quite satisfied.The LG 32LH30 is a solid, no fuss, TV that delivers a good picture with excellent sound clarity for speech.  With non-HD satellite as input, have not noted significant image blurring on sports programs.  That is, players and balls always appear as solid, clear images.  On other programs, such as newscasts, faces of commentators are sometimes soft when they move their head or the camera angle changes.  Color is quite natural and consistent, aided by good contrast. Was easy to set up and configure. Nicely done stand. One can swivel and tilt the set easily.The one complaint is the inability to size the image as I would like.  The options provide for a smaller image than the screen size - the picture is a smaller rectangle surrounded by a lot of black (like 24 inch inside a 32 inch area), a full screen with `squished' vertical and elongated horizontal, or, using the zoom setting, a full screen that cuts of maybe an inch or two of the picture at the top and bottom - you don't see much of the crawl, if any, at the bottom or the score box shown at the top of a sports program.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, lack of output options, no program description
Reviews.Author: Bought it in MN
Reviews.Content: The TV's picture quality is excellent.  And the tuner is excellent - actually pulling in a channel I didn't even know existed before.  The sound quality is also nice.I have 2 complaints (and if I'm missing something, please respond and let me know):*There are about 50 ways to plug things *into* this tv, but there appears to be a single audio-out option - Optical out.  I have an older but perfectly adequate Sony stereo receiver with nice speakers and a powered subwoofer.  It'd be really nice to run the audio from this TV into my stereo, but, unbelievably to me, there is only one way to do this: using an optical out cable.  My stereo does not have an optical-in option.  So my 12 year old 19" TV had more options than this.  I guess I'll never watch a movie again in surround sound with decent bass unless I manage to hook my DVD player up to my stereo directly.  If I want audio from regular TV to come out of my stereo - totally out of luck.  I just can't believe they'd skip a simple RCA-cable audio-out.*Complaint 2:  With our $10 digital converter box we could see a program description and a "What's next" description as well, describing both how long the current show is and what is next up.This TV, with its many bells and whistles doesn't even display this.  Our $10 converter box beats this TV on that point.  I feel like I have to be missing something because I just can't believe it, but I've gone thru every option I can find and pressed every button on the remote in every combination I can think of and still can't get more than very basic channel information to display.

Reviews.Title: nice set
Reviews.Author: Kevin J. Geban "Khidbz"
Reviews.Content: Very nice set. I use this as a bedroom set and the picture and sound are really good. I don't like PicBridge too much and just keep it on default settings. Was trying to set up a laptop on it the other day but it has no S-Video input....you will have to use the SVGA and external speakers.

Reviews.Title: So easy to use, right out of box
Reviews.Author: west5567
Reviews.Content: I don't know anything about hooking up electronics or calibrating TV's, but this was just TOO easy.  I had made arrangements with a friend of mine to come over and make adjustments, but once I got the TV plugged in and the HDMI's hooked up, then selected the Home viewing mode (as opposed to Store), there really wasn't a need to do any calibrating.  At frist, I had difficulty with the picture when watching DVD's (white flecks), but it turns out it was just a bad HDMI cable.  The sound is great, as far as I can tell.  Awesome volume on it.  This is my first foray into HDTV's, so I don't have much to compare it to.  But the picture is crisp and I haven't noticed any blurring when watching football.  I'm just so relieved to have picked such a great TV on my first try, but the reviews on this one were so good, and I got a great price.  I will definitely look into other LG's when I need a new TV for the living room.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: D. Ostrander
Reviews.Content: Wow. I am so pleased with this purchase. Not only is the product I purchased everything that it was supposed to be, the purchase through Amazon Prime was flawless. My wife and I both agree that all other purchases will be through Amazon Prime. $3.99 for overnight shipping is unbelievable but true. Ordered this TV at noon on Wednesday and FedX was at my door Thursday at 4 pm. Unit was delivered in perfect condition and worked right out of box. This was the second TV we purchased. The first one taking 10 days to get here and when it arrived it didn't work. There was some anxious moments when attempts to contact [...] were futile. They only list an email address for returns. In all fairness to them they did send me an RMA for the return of the defective TV. Can't go wrong if looking for a bedroom TV with the LG product. Highly recommend Amazon Prime for internet shopping.

Reviews.Title: Tremendous TV for a small room.  LG movin on up like the Jeffersons!
Reviews.Author: Fat Matt
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Superb picture quality-Beautifully designed (Piano black looks great!)-low def signals look better than on my previous HDTVCons:-Initial picture set up was tedious-Not much bass in audioI've owned this TV for two months.  It's the first TV I've purchased online (Don't tell Amazon but I got it from another website.....Sorry Amazon, I still love you!).This is easily the best TV I've owned.  It's the second HDTV I've owned.  For the money you just can't do better.  However, I should have gotten a larger screen for my large den but that's not the TV's fault (entertainment center couldn't hold a bigger TV).I use the TV for watching blu-ray movies, playing PS3 games, and watching Standard-Def Satellite TV.Out of the box it took me a while to get the picture set up.  There were so many settings I wasn't familiar with.  However, I think my time spent with the settings was worth it.  As I mentioned above the picture quality is superb.Picture quality is beautiful when watching blu-ray movies or playing PS3.  This TV does a great job making my standard definition satellite signal look good (took some time playing with settings).One excellent feature is that it saves your picture settings for each input.  This is useful because once you have picture set for each input it automatically adjusts when you switch between inputs.  My previous TV did not have this.The audio is ok.  In summary, the sound is very clear but lacks deep bass.As I said earlier I should have gotten a larger screen.  Because of my long viewing distance from couch to screen it's difficult to appreciate the additional detail of 1080p over 720p (my previous 32" HDTV was Insignia 720p).  When close to the TV the detail is absolutely incredible.In conclusion, I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone needing a great HDTV in a small room.  This was my first LG purchase and I'm very satisfied with this product's quality.  LG is definitely catching up to Samsung which I believe to be the best.

Reviews.Title: A Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: B.M.C
Reviews.Content: This is a smart buy if you can get a great price like I did... Even if you pay a little more, its still worth the money...The picture is very clear with nice blacks and even looks good in standard mode, the speakers are surprisingly of good quality, and the assembly is so easy you could do it in five minutes or less...My only complaint is that there is no headphone jack or analog audio out so I could not hook up my external speakers, (there is an optical digital audio out), but since the sound from the built in speakers is good I find myself quickly getting over it whenever I watch a movie or play a game, (And I am a pretty picky person when it comes to sound)...The gloss finish is beautiful but does attract dust... However, LG was nice enough to include a dust cleaning cloth with the package so that takes care of that problem...Navigating the menus and the layout of the remote are pretty pleasing, so there should be no problem there for most people...This is worth the money and a very smart buy for a 32 inch tv and if you can get over not being able to hook up external speakers easily with analog sound then you will be very, very happy with this choice...

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: D. Budhoo
Reviews.Content: Did everything i wanted. I don't know what all the problems with hooking this up with the ps3 was all about. I bought Hdmi High Definition Multimedia Interface 6 Foot Cable for Playstation 3 Ps3 and it all worked out great. Blu Ray movies show up clear, games are smooth and general tv, well, i don't have the hdmi box, so it's in standard def. There are also power saver options and this thing that allows you to customize your tv for games, movies etc...Great Buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Price and good picture
Reviews.Author: Dexstar11
Reviews.Content: The TV looks good when viewing HD stations.  The only issue I have is that is does not have a auto adjust for different picture ratios. When I tune to a non HD station showing a film in the 16:9 format it does not fill out to the edges. I have to go in and manual set it.

Reviews.Title: Stylish, sleek and great picture.
Reviews.Author: Zulma Johnson
Reviews.Content: The LG 32LH30 32 Inch LCD HDTV in high black gloss is beautiful.  It is so stylish, sleek and easy to use.  The colors are vivid and the picture is sharp and vibrant.  The audio sound is clean and has excellent clarity.  Setup was simple.  I especially liked the feature that allows you to name the inputs you have connected, even shows a cute little animated picture of the item (ie: hand controller picture for a game).  Since I also ordered the LG BD 370 Network Blu-ray Disc Player, syncing the items was a breeze and can be operated with one remote since they are both LG products.The only negative thing I can say for this TV is that it only has one component input, I wish it had at least two.  It does come with 2 AV and 3 HDMI inputs but I at least needed one more component input to set up my Wii in HD format. My cable box has a slot for an HDMI cable, but I kept receiving a an error message on the TV (something about HDVI) and the sound kept coming in and out.  So I had to use the one component input for my cable box.  If someone knows how I can get around this, please let me know in my comment section.Other than what I stated above, this HDTV is a great buy. I am extremely pleased with my purchase and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable HDTV with great features and technology .  It comes with a one labor and parts warranty.

Reviews.Title: Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Terry Flick "Tex Flix"
Reviews.Content: I had a specific entertainment cabinet to fill in my gameroom, so I did quite a bit of research on 32" 1080p HDTV's. I found that this model from LG both fit my size and budgetary needs. It was very easy to set up, but I would recommend that you purchase a set of HDMI cables (one for cable/satellite and another for blueray/dvd player). This set has a very simple menu options for picture quality, sound options and input selections. The only nit I could pick is that the picture tends to be rather dark and this is after I've played with both manual and preset display options. I'm sure that there are higher quality options out there, but if you're looking to save a couple hundred bucks, this is the way to go in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: LG - LH30
Reviews.Author: A. Valdez
Reviews.Content: Great LCD TV.  Very impressed with the shipping and the quality of the product.  Right from the box to my bedroom and was setup and running within 15 minutes.  Picture is great!  Great television for a bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: T. Land
Reviews.Content: We love our LG TV. The only reason I gave it a 4-star rating instead of a 5-star rating is that the menu is a bit confusing for someone like me who is NOT obsessed with every technical aspect of AV equipment and, therefore, doesn't know what everything means. There needs to be some dumbing down of the manual as well.But the picture and sound are great. I have no idea what these people are talking about who say they can see some weirdness with a couple of the pixels and bleeding/fading around the edges of the picture in a dark room. If you have a LIFE, then you'll enjoy the heck out of this TV. For those of you who think sitting in a dark room playing video games or watching movies all day and night is living, well...Late last night I couldn't get a picture...only sound. I called the cable people and they said it was the TV. I held for an hour for help from the LG 800 number. When the guy got on the line, he was very apologetic and extremely helpful. (Apparently, their system went down and I was just stubborn enough to stay on the line.) He explained that it was the cable and waited on the phone while I ran the cable directly into the TV to make sure. Then I called the cable people back and it took another half-hour to do all the tests they wanted me to do in order to prove to them it was the cable box, NOT the TV. So their customer service is good as long as their system doesn't crash and you have to wait forever.Amazon gave us a great price and with Prime Shipping, it was here in two days FREE. I know, Prime memberships cost $, but I've more than made up for that membership fee by having my son's textbooks sent to them for free as well as many Christmas presents, etc.We also got a LG Blu-ray DVD player for Christmas. It seems to be terrific as well. Kudos LG. I'm happy with my LG cell phone, so decided on the LG TV. Glad I did!

Reviews.Title: LG - Life is Very Good
Reviews.Author: The Hammer
Reviews.Content: I purchased a LG TV over one year ago so LG was the way I was going. Amazon had great pricing, shipment of the TV was quick and as always the LG is so easy to set up..Amazon standby for more business from a very satisfied customer

Reviews.Title: Dishonest practices by LG NO longer an s-ips panel using cheaper tawian and chinease panels
Reviews.Author: Johnny O
Reviews.Content: After seeing all the raving reviews i was disappointed with the picture quality even after 3 or so hours of tweaking i could not get picture quality better then my TN panel 24" monitor.  I thought i just hadn't calibrated it enough and that an S-IPS panel should be capable of more. Then i came across a review here about the panel being switched so i took out my flashlight and looked at the back vents sure enough it had a sticker that said AUO it was using a cheap Taiwan AUO panel with inferior picture quality not S-ISP.  Apparently the newer models are using even cheaper Chinese made panel with even worse picture quality.So all those great reviews you see are of the old superior quality S-IPS panel type and do not apply to if you bought it now.What really gets me is the dishonesty of LG  to continue to advertise all there lcd as using S-IPS panels when this is clearly not the case one of the main seeling points for me was the S-IPS panel I don't believe I'm gonna buy another lg product ever again after this.I Plan on returning this and getting a panasonic 32" instead one of the few manufacturers along with apple and nec that guarantees an ips panel and does not swap out for a cheaper panel a few months down the line once all the good reviews come in.

Reviews.Title: LG32LH30 32 INCH 1080p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: A. Mathur
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my basement and to use in the gym, so far i am enjoying it. I have no complaints for the quality and the price that I paid for. This is a good 1080p TV as long as you are not watching sports. It is excellent in other ways.

Reviews.Title: D.'s Review
Reviews.Author: D. Long
Reviews.Content: Picture Quality:Head-on picture is beautiful, but, unless you are directly infront of the screen, entire screen is "Washed Out".  Brightsunshine also washes out picture... even Head-on.Ease of Use:Unless I haven't figured it out yet (and, admittedly, I havenot yet tried too hard) switching from TV to AV (DVD Recorder/Player) is not intuitive.  Having to actually change Input beforeyou can see recorded video... rather than simply hit Play... isannoying.Sound: Good / Beautiful to Look at:  Yes.D. Long

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I had been shopping for a new LCD TV and once this was the 'Deal of the DAy' in the Gold Box, I could not resist. The picture, sound and ease of the menus are fantastic. Highly recommended for the user that does not want to take a course on how to turn on the TV. Thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great for your second room
Reviews.Author: James Morales
Reviews.Content: After working at best buy in the hometheater dept you develop a dorkishly fond interest in electronics.  If you have a keen eye for quality or have OCD you will be distracted by the motion jutter on this TV.  For example, "A bugs life" when they're cascading over the grass, the grass instead of being clear is all blurred.Now REGARDLESS of what ever I just said if you can get this tv under four hundred bucks you are making a good purchase.  You basically have to make a comprimise, price and it's purpose over quality.  I have this tv for my bedroom and it's great.  On the wall, stylish and serves it's purpose.  I have a Sony XBR LCD in the main room and even though it's twice as large it still has a better picture.It's funny I remember starting out looking for  a 32 inch in the 3-4 hundred price range caught myself drifting into the 1000 to 1500 price range because you'll always find something better.  Then I remembered I already have a main tv for viewing, and 3D technology as well as other technological advancements will be out before  you know it and then you'll want another tv as well as already have the one you bought just been outdated.  So if you want to fill the void now but loose less money when you decide to upgrade by xmas or sooner, choose this one or something like it.I could've saved you from reading all this if I just put this up first:  GREAT PRICE, GREAT LOOK, TERRIBLE 60hz motion.  Then again you're probably not me like me and are not dorkishly into this stuff, so just get this tv! :)

Reviews.Title: LG 32LH30
Reviews.Author: Michael H. Smith
Reviews.Content: Ordered during one of Amazons "limited time" sales at a great price $379 free shipping. I had been watching the 32" LCD TV's for specials, they had a similar offer for the Samsung but after reading reviews I was convinced the Samsung shortcomings and it was dropped off the short list. As I own another Samsung and have never had any problems, I was dismayed to read all the bad press. Fortunately I also own another LG LCD TV that I am very happy with, so I was familiar with the general operation. First, the LG was delivered on time and inspection of the box revealed good condition. Installed the stand in minutes and although not needed, was pleased with the swivel operation, additionally the TV is much lighter than the same size Sharp it was replacing, making it a good candidate for ceiling or wall mount. After power up, I inspected and found zero dead pixels. After syncing the LG with the Cable box remote, I began the initial set up, which is an easy process to follow on screen. The LG remote is fairly basic and not as nice as our other LG Remote but really is a moot point since we use the Cable box remote 99% of the time. All the HD chanels colors were crisp, clear and brilliant, non-HD channels were acceptable. Blacks are close to perfect for me and much better than the Sharp. I did not experience the sound syncing problem that other reviewers noted. The level and range of adjustments available is great for those that like to tweak. I tried some adjustments which made the display near perfect even for my old eyes. Sound amplification is far superior to the Sharp and allows for adjustments to match to our room. Since we have seperate surround system the volume limitations some reviewers spoke of, were not as important to us. Response time seems much faster than the Sharp. Since this TV is viewed almost straight on, there is no issue with fading when viewing from a side angle. Personal reasons for this purchase (or justification to satisfy my wife) size 32" is the largest we can fit in the cabinet, (that is staying); 1080P; multiple adjustment parameters; volume amplification; Price$$ (lowest I found); Free shipping; good looking cabinet; multiple HDMI connections; used Amazon credit card which spreads payments over 6 months. I couldnt ask for much more and would highly recommend this product and Amazon.

Reviews.Title: My LG TV is GREAT!!!!!
Reviews.Author: W. Ford
Reviews.Content: this tv is great I recived it & intalled it right out of the box & is works wonderfully no problems & no damged pixels just a great tv

Reviews.Title: Using as Computer Monitor-HDMI
Reviews.Author: H. Huey
Reviews.Content: I chose this monitor over all of the rest of the 32 inch 1080 HDTVs primarily because a few reviewers had actually used it as a computer monitor and had reported no artifacts in the display of text and computer graphics that can happen due to mismatch of the dpi or computer text and HDTV for certain number of columns of text characters. Note that most other purchasers of Sony, Panasonic, Samsung and Toshiba had never used it for computer hookups!!!In general the 32 inch LG comes off just great in the display of my HP laptop that has direct HDMI A/V. But for a complete review let me just state a few facts/notes for anyone contemplating a similar usage  - VGA resolution is limited on most all HDTVs and not useful, something like 1200x800 or so  - On HDMI/HDTV you can "get" up to 1980x1080 or so but there is a 3/4 inch blank spot around the screen and it does not appear natural, I operate at a more natural 1600x1200 that makes the windows larger but the entire screen is used and most programs esp browsers let you re-size the resolution to fit any size window if you can still read em  - At this resolution you can easily view/edit 2 docs side by side and not get eye strain, in fact you can usually read the screen from up to 3 feet away or more so no more hunching of the back. You also can place the screen far back on ur desk and actually get more space than trying to use 2 19-21 inch monitors side by side. Also the extra room at the top of the screen can be used to see 1 or 2 partial screens activity that I use for email and stock watch, something that 2 side by sides of smaller monitors cannot do  - Audio on monitor - Audio over HDMI worked perfectly at the start but my Vista laptop got confused as to the default and setups (too many audio control screens)  and accasionally would not turn on audio automatically when I disconnected, so after wrestling with it I make the laptop speaker the default all the time and use powered speakers from the connector, though the units HDMI audio sounds just great to me esp when compared to my external powered system.  - Brightness - Just great, truly impressed by color and contrast also.  - Power Control - HDMI///It does not power on from laptop when its completely in standby like VGA, I have to switch it back on, might be some adjustment I can make on either/both sides. It does respond in partial standby just fine. Reoslution recognition and memory seems just fine and no mixup after many connects/disconnects.  - Power/Heat - Haven't measured its power usage but so far its not generating much heat so cannot complain. The laptop seems to run hotter with the higher resolution though.In general its a great choice and former eye strain and fatigue are gone, back feels better and If I want I can look at stuff from 3-5 feet away and just sit back!!  Next time I might try to stuff a 37 incher on the desk and see if I get more windows in view!Hope this helps anyone out there!

Reviews.Title: Well worth the wait
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Rackham
Reviews.Content: Waited 3 years to get a new Tv. When this Tv came up at $100.00 less than Best Buy sale price i could not resist. 1080p at same cost as 720p in the stores what a deal. Great picture, good sound and easy set up. As a 1st LCD Tv i could not have made a better choice.

Reviews.Title: perfect small tv
Reviews.Author: Riley L. Reynolds "Riley"
Reviews.Content: i like bought this for my bedroom to go at the foot of the bed, its he perfect size for that. the blue ray nd upscaled dvds are nice and crisp with none of the weird artifacts you get with the newer motion enhanced tvs. decent color in cinema mode. my only complaint is the few connections on the back and i can't figure out how to get sound out of the tv speakers when the source come through hdmi.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: B. Carmichael
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect!  It fits great in larger or smaller wall-spaces!  The picture and sound quality is as good as any other model without the expensive price tag.

Reviews.Title: Great Inexpensive LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: David Roberts
Reviews.Content: Great deal for what I paid.... This is THE HDTV to get if you are on a budget.  The only thing I don't like is no Audio Out.

Reviews.Title: Excelente!!
Reviews.Author: Rafael Ruiz "Rafa"
Reviews.Content: Excelente TV, llegó en perfectas condiciones aca a Venezuela, uno se ahorra un dineral ya que aqui se consiguen muchos mas caros, lo recomiendo 100%

Reviews.Title: Wrong set, but the price was right
Reviews.Author: Conehead
Reviews.Content: I ordered the 32LH30 on a one-day special which provided 3 HDMI jacks, and I ordered the 3 HDMI cables offered with that set. Instead, Amazon sent me a 32LH30-UA which provides only 2 HDMI jacks, leaving me with a wasted cable. Amazon was completely unresponsive to the concerns I e-mailed.As to the set, this is my first digital set, and I use it beside my 61" analog set. One big drawback for me is that the set doesn't show closed captioning through the HDMI cable from my new VCR-DVD recorder combo unit, nor does it show the analog display information from that unit. It does display both through composite cables. I called LG with these concerns, but couldn't get past the confused non-technical representative. The owner's manual is on a CD which saves paper but requires me to leave the set to go to my desktop computer in another room.The set has greater complexity than my analog set but is easy to use, and the picture was fine; picture source is analog and digital cable, not HD. Style and appearance are adequate; all these sets look pretty much alike to me. Despite all this, the price was great. (The last rating category was "Dead" which I took to mean "Deal.")

Reviews.Title: LG 32LH30  aMaZiNg
Reviews.Author: Runner "Run"
Reviews.Content: i use this tv for xbox 360 only, with hdmi.awesome picture quality, sound, and design.the only reason i only game on this tv is because i have a bad cable provider with crappy quality and wouldnt waste it on such a nice tv.but everything is great on this tv.best picture quality of any tv i have had.the only thing i dislike, is that when the tv is turned on, and not in any input modes, basically in like the home screen, i notice a very faint hum noise from the back of the tv. but as long as you are not a neat freak like me, you will notice it.5 stars

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: This TV took a total of 30 minutes to unpack, hook up, and run!  What a beauty!  Picture is excellent with loads of adjustments possible.  Ok, the black's a little weak but not that bad.  I have it in my bedroom hooked up to Dish Network.  Considered Samsung 720p for more money but this one was a steal.  LG makes a great product.  Buy it, you won't be unhappy!

Reviews.Title: Great quality TV, best 32" for the price when I bought it years ago.
Reviews.Author: Deusilan
Reviews.Content: This TV is great!  No complaints about it whatsoever, it plays beautiful images and has great onboard speakers.  It makes me want to stick with LG when I'm ready to buy a bigger screen for my living room.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Eric Coldwell
Reviews.Content: Great quality, we have had this tv for quite awhile now and still runs great, and looks great. Yes, I would recommend this to someone else.

Reviews.Title: It's Still going
Reviews.Author: Imagine "Julii"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV over two years ago and I mounted it on my wall directly in front my Bed. Even when mounted high the sound is great, sometimes too great and I end up tuning the tv down to level 10 or 12. Sharp picture output without HDMI cables being connected. This year I did decide to hook it up to HDMI cables and HD satellite service and I must say I was really cheating myself out of a great experience. Netflix look stunning when its streaming on this set. I am in love with this TV, quality is awesome with AND without the HD hook up. My Hubby loves how easy the setup is. Labeling input is easy, when you plug your cables into the set whichever port you are using lights up on the screen and it helps you label which one you are using so you don't get confused. On my old TV I spend hours guessing.  I also like that there is a main power switch hiding on the right hand side so you are not relying on just your remote to turn it off/on. I really look at it as a mommy feature. When my son started grade school he had a hard time adjusting to the rules of bedtime and even though I set the timer for 30 minutes, he'd turn it back on when he woke in the middle of the night. I ended up having run in and click the switch to prevent him from turning it on again in the event he woke up. That worked like a charm. And the feature that won me over was that it was an energy star product so it didn't send my electric bill through the darn roof. You can set how bright or how dim you want your screen which helped me, even on the 50 inch model I purchased. When my son was younger and I wanted him to know it was time for bed I dimmed the screen to its lowest setting and would turn it back up to medium in the day time (The screen is very bright! You may have to adjust it upon initial setup so it wont irritate your eyes, I am a migraine sufferer so I just want throw that out there just in case someone is sensitive to bright lights like me) In the first week it gave me bad headaches until I got the gist of how to dim the screen. Other than that, there was no real issue that I have with this unit. To this day the TV is working like its brand spanking new. You wont be mad you spent the extra cash to get it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Julie L. Herron "Herron"
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for a few years now(5 I think) and it's been great. Picture is fantastic and I've had no issue with dead pixels or any malfunctions. The synch with other LG products (I have an LG Bluray player) works like a charm.

Reviews.Title: 32LH30 - a great starter LCD tv
Reviews.Author: InfernoWRX
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of NOT screwing down/securing the base of the LG unit. On the first evening, our cat jumped on the top edge of the LG tv, and it came crashing down to the floor. We heard the unmistakeable sound of breaking glass with the hollow boom from the plastic shell. You'd think that a drum set was thrown out the window. I was horrified. Fortunately, the LH30 only had a scratch and was functioning completely fine.Needless to say, LG makes fantastic products and I have not been disappointed with my HDTV purchase. At first, I hesitated when Amazon had this unit as a Deal of the Day and missed out. I was so upset at the passed opportunity but then happy again when it re-appeared at the discounted price.It has one of the best and brightest screens for a 60hz unit. The set-up was a little tricky but smooth sailing after a few initial hiccups. I really liked the auto tuner feature of getting the available/free HD stations. For cable subscribers, upgrade to an HD cable box to take advantage of the brilliant screen and colors. There are a thousands of ways to customize your settings, but the interface is very easy to navigate.I've had the LH30 for almost two years and have not been disappointed with my purchase. When I upgrade to a 42" or larger screen, it will definitely be an LG unit with 120hz, LED back-light, and WiFi access.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Astesana
Reviews.Content: Picked this up on Amazon for about 350 in the end of 2010 and LOVE it. I keep looking for something as good of a picture. It has greeat menu elections, awesome features, and lots of connections. I would buy more of these if i needed them, I wouldnt look anymore if i was searching the net. Oh and Anyone who hasnt heard of LG, or dont know what they are into, Lg is HUGE and worldwide making anything and everything. In the US they have great cust service, and I have used them is a few other countries, all same quality.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 15 months warranty was 12 months
Reviews.Author: D. Powell
Reviews.Content: 15 months, mother board blew. Cost of the parts plus labour to fix it was almost as much as the TV cost new. LG only offered a 30 guarantee on their repairs so we just threw it in the trash.I will never buy any LG product again, ever!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Basir
Reviews.Content: I got this for $300 shipped in Late 2009 or Early 2010 and can't complain at that price. Good picture quality for a kitchen TV.However, once I turned on the TV and it was majorly tinted green and there was no sound. I unplugged the TV and the satellite box and all was well when I replugged the next day. Might have been the satellite box, I'll never know.

Reviews.Title: A Really Nice 32" TV (that doubles as a monitor)
Reviews.Author: J. Giles
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on Amazon coming up on 2 years ago.  It still performs as it did out of the box, amazingly.I use it every day.  I use it for a TV to view shows via cable.  I also use this with a KVM switch (Belkin SOHO) as the main monitor for 3 different PCs/Laptops (Dell tower/ HP & Acer laptops) and use it for work EVERY DAY.  While used with the PC's it streams video perfectly including sites/apps like netflix and itunes.The Full HD makes it very universal for integrating into your PC world.  The 32" screen is more than enough 'desktop' real estate and a very clear picture.  The picture can be fine tuned so that its not hard on the eyes.  There is a built in picture wizard that makes this an easy task.The gloss black housing looks very nice on the desk with other PC accessories as most are gloss black.  Many colleages have visit my office and are always amazed with how clear the 'monitor' is.This is an great alternative to the extremely expensive 32" monitors on the market.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it without a warranty but customer service EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: TonyVig
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV in 2009. It came with a 1 year warranty, but no offer to extend the warranty was ever proposed.  Of course, now that the warranty is up, the TV is not working.  It started with a horizontal line across the bottom of the screen.  Just a thin line.  Gradually it is progressing into a flashing picture throughout the entire screen.  I called LG and all they did was send me phone numbers of repair people who said that it will cost more to repair than to just buy a new one.  So, beware.UPDATE.  Even though the warranty was up I called LG and they were able to cover the repair cost.  TV is fixed for free and repair man said it was very unusual to experience this problem.  So, I'd still buy an LG.  Thanks especially to customer service agent Rigoberto Joe at LG - he was great.

Reviews.Title: This TV doesn't last very long.
Reviews.Author: W. Luebbers
Reviews.Content: On Feb 7th 2010, I bought this very same TV. A 32" 32LH30 1080p.I loved the price, and I liked the picture and sound, and it's a sharp looking TV as well.However, not long after it was purchased, the left half of the screen became faded out while the right half remained nice. This problem gradually became much worse, to the point that the left half is maybe 50% faded and less saturated then the right side. So, this TV started out very nice, with a great price at the time. If I had reviewed it then, I would have given a nice rating, but only months later my opinion changed, and now, I would not recommend this TV to anybody. In fact, after searching on the internet I have found major screen problems to be very common on LG TVs that are not very old. Even on LG's other models and sizes.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: JK
Reviews.Content: got this for around 380$ from amazon daily deals so great for pricepros:great optionsgood picture qualityeasy to use1080plots of HDMI portsgreat contrast ratio for 32 inchhave not had any dead pixels or maintenance issuescons:not an LEDdoes not make a sound when turns oncan take a few seconds to turn on

Reviews.Title: Amazing MAC monitor and TV
Reviews.Author: Peter....
Reviews.Content: I use it for MAC mini and as a TV with small antenna. Works great!I wish it doesn't require manual adjusting of V & H Sharpness for sharp image when connected to the computer via HDMI cable.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Benjones
Reviews.Content: I love this 1080p  32"tv. It is very clear, and I love that it is 1080p, instead of 720p. I love it!

Reviews.Title: LCD 32 Inch LG
Reviews.Author: Justin "J.A."
Reviews.Content: So far I have had my LG LCD 32 Television for a little over 7 months without any problems, great looking picture, just an awesome Television. Another plus was the cheap price on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Good TV For The Price
Reviews.Author: A. Dibble
Reviews.Content: I will start out by saying that I use this TV as a computer monitor, so my experiences are different from others.I normally sit about 2 feet from the TV, as it is situated on my desk behind my keyboard and MIDI keyboard.  It's works great so far; no dead pixels and great contrast and color.  The only downsides come from me using it as a monitor: it does not auto power up and down with my computer, which means I have to manually turn it on and off.  Otherwise, the screen real estate and picture quality are great.I can easily display 2 windows side-by-side.  I prefer it over using 2 monitors because it takes less power and there is no gap in the middle.  Some may argue that it is only 1920 pixels wide.  However, because the screen is so large, the text can be set smaller and is just as easy to see, giving the same sense of real estate.If you can find this TV on sale, I say buy it with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Exceded my Expectations
Reviews.Author: katyo
Reviews.Content: This tv is so great--I bought it in used condition, and I was not expecting much, but wow! it's so great! Great picture quality, excellent sound quality...Everything I was hoping for! I definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, really
Reviews.Author: Julius Barns
Reviews.Content: This tv is very nice. I like everything about it: sleek design, great sound, terrific picture. The remote is very well done too. It is easy to use, has great menu and it complements our room's appearance. Movies and TV news look spectacular on it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV a few months ago and it is the best set in my house. We have 2 other flat panel LCD televisions but this has the best picture. I like that it has an energy saving feature, however we rarely use it since it does make the picture quite faint. The remote is easy to use and we didn't have any issues with set up.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD TV at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Jakpro
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this television. After setting it up properly, the picture is excellent. I used the video settings found here in the reviews and on [...]. I compared this TV to other models and the picture was as good or better than any of the other manufacturers. We really wanted a larger screen, but that would have meant a new TV stand, stereo stand, speaker stands. This one fits perfect.The price is great at $400-450. However, the new one is quite a bit higher priced. The only thing that I do not like is the lack of audio out RCA jacks for my older stereo. I am able to work around this lack of jacks by using the audio jacks on my cable/DVR box.I have read complaints regarding the sound quality, but it seems pretty good to me.

Reviews.Title: LOVED IT! - which i could get another one for my daughter
Reviews.Author: July Magalong "july"
Reviews.Content: the tv arrived on time.  it's big & clear with no issues/problem.  @ first my boyfriend taught it was pretty big but in the end, he was happy with the tv.  can't beat a 32 inch 1080p for less than $400.  i even recommended it to my sister coz' she said that all the tv's she saw was over $500.  so for the price i paid for - it's definitely a steal!  check it out yourself!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Bizzr
Reviews.Content: I'm using this as a PC monitor / slash bedroom tv.For a bedroom tv watching cable the sound works amazingly well. My PC has it's own 7.1 speaker system, for blue ray, games, music etc. I like this tv alot.Plus, can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: LG  32-Inch 1080p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: J. Nahorniak
Reviews.Content: This thing definitely delivers it's bang for your buck.  I was impressed with what I received and what I paid for such an excellent television.  The remote was easy to navigate for first time set-up, the t.v will tell you which inputs are plugged in and ready, you won't have to cycle through 12 inputs to be able to find which one you plugged in.  I recently purchased an HD Receiver to go with the t.v, I have to say I am blown away by the picture and sound quality.  I give this t.v a 5/5, a great purchase and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV For A Great Price
Reviews.Author: SA
Reviews.Content: I am technically challenged. Setting up this TV was shockingly easy.I have to say, I really don't know much about electronics but I did research.I wanted a good product and did not need all the bells and whistles.This 1080 LG has good picture, sound and I could connect my computer to it.I have a small space so the 32" was perfect. Price was perfect too.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Robert Kane
Reviews.Content: The picture is crisp and bold, the sound is a definite improvement over my old LCD TV, stylish with a lot of inputs and features, and it's a steal under $500.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV with a lot of interfaces
Reviews.Author: Beach Bum "HBG"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these and love them. I've had no problems with the TV. The sound was kinda low but I found a setting on the cable box that made a huge different in the clarity.  Besides the picture the nice thing about this TV is all the interfaces it comes with to connect all your accessories.  Was thinking about buying a third one to replace the last old TV in the house.  LG makes a good product.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Bedrooms.
Reviews.Author: vbrookie
Reviews.Content: This would be perfect for small living room or bedroom.  This unit fit perfectly on my bedroom.  My father was so impressed he wanted one so I bought another one for his birthday.Yes.It was that good in price/value wise, I just had to buy another one.
